arabicText: ۞ وَعِندَهُمْ قَـٰصِرَٰتُ ٱلطَّرْفِ أَتْرَابٌ
englishTranslationText:
And	with	them	are	the	pure	spouses,	who	
do	not	set	gaze	upon	men	except	their	
husbands,	of	single	age.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	ke	pās	woh	bibiyāñ	haiñ	ke	apne	
shauhar	ke	siwā	aur	ki	ṭaraf	āañkh	nahiñ	
uthātiñ	aik	'umar	ki.

arabicText: هَـٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِيَوْمِ ٱلْحِسَابِ
englishTranslationText:
This	is	the	promise	being	given	to	you,	for	
the	Day	of	Reckoning.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ye	hai	woh	jis	kā	tumheñ	w'ada	diyā	jātā	
hai	ḥisāb	ke	din.

arabicText: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَرِزْقُنَا مَا لَهُۥ مِن نَّفَادٍ
englishTranslationText: Indeed	this	is	Our	sustenance,	which	will	never	end.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	ye	Hamārā	Rizq	hai	ke	kabhi	
khatm	na	hogā.

arabicText: هَـٰذَا ۚ وَإِنَّ لِلطَّـٰغِينَ لَشَرَّ مَـَٔابٍۢ
englishTranslationText: This	is	for	the	virtuous;	and	indeed	for	the	rebellious	is	a	wretched	destination.
romanUrduTranslationText: Un	ko	to	ye	hai	aur	be-shak	sarkashoñ	kā	burā	thikānā.

arabicText: جَهَنَّمَ يَصْلَوْنَهَا فَبِئْسَ ٱلْمِهَادُ
englishTranslationText: Hell;	which	they	shall	enter;	what	an	evil	resting-place!
romanUrduTranslationText: Jahannam	ke	us	meiñ	jāyeñ	ge	to	kyā		hi	burā	bichhaunā.

arabicText: هَـٰذَا فَلْيَذُوقُوهُ حَمِيمٌۭ وَغَسَّاقٌۭ
englishTranslationText: This	is	for	the	criminals	–	so	that	they	may	taste	it	-	boiling	hot	water	and	pus.
romanUrduTranslationText: Un	ko	ye	hai	to	isey	chakheñ	khaultā	pāni	aur	peep

arabicText: وَءَاخَرُ مِن شَكْلِهِۦٓ أَزْوَٰجٌ
englishTranslationText: And	similar	other	punishments	in	pairs.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	isi	shakl	ke	aur	jode

arabicText: هَـٰذَا فَوْجٌۭ مُّقْتَحِمٌۭ مَّعَكُمْ ۖ لَا مَرْحَبًۢا بِهِمْ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ صَالُوا۟ ٱلنَّارِ
englishTranslationText:
“Here	is	another	group	that	was	with	you,	falling	along	with	you”;	they	will	answer,	“Do	not	give	
them	plenty	of	open	space;	they	surely	have	to	enter	the	fire	–	let	them	also	be	confined!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Un	se	kahā	jāye	gā	ye	aik	aur	fauj	tumhāre	sāth	dhañsi	padti	hai	jo	tumhāri	thi	woh	kaheñ	ge	un	
ko	khuli	jagah	na	milo	āag	meiñ	to	inko	jānā	hi	hai.

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ بَلْ أَنتُمْ لَا مَرْحَبًۢا بِكُمْ ۖ أَنتُمْ قَدَّمْتُمُوهُ لَنَا ۖ فَبِئْسَ ٱلْقَرَارُ
englishTranslationText:
The	followers	will	say,	“In	fact,	for	you!	May	you	not	get	open	space!	It	is	you	who	brought	this	
calamity	upon	us!”	So	what	a	wretched	destination.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Wahañ	bhi	tang	jagah	meiñ	raheñ	tāb'e	bole	balke	tumheñ	khuli	jagah	na	milo	ye	museebat	tum	
hamāre	āage	lāye	to	kyā		hi	burā	thikānā.

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَا مَن قَدَّمَ لَنَا هَـٰذَا فَزِدْهُ عَذَابًۭا ضِعْفًۭا فِى ٱلنَّارِ
englishTranslationText:
They	say,	“Our	Lord!	Whoever	has	brought	this	calamity	upon	us	-	double	the	punishment	of	the	
fire	for	him!”
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	bole	aey	hamāre	Rab!	Jo	ye	museebat	hamāre	āage	lāyā	usey	āag	meiñ	doonā	áƶāb	badhā.

arabicText: وَقَالُوا۟ مَا لَنَا لَا نَرَىٰ رِجَالًۭا كُنَّا نَعُدُّهُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَشْرَارِ
englishTranslationText:
And	they	say,	“What	is	the	matter	with	us	
that	we	do	not	see	the	men	whom	we	
thought	were	evil?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	bole	hameñ	kyā	huā	ham	un	mardoñ	
ko	nahiñ	dekhte	jinheñ	burā	samajhte	the

arabicText: أَتَّخَذْنَـٰهُمْ سِخْرِيًّا أَمْ زَاغَتْ عَنْهُمُ ٱلْأَبْصَـٰرُ
englishTranslationText:
“Did	we	mock	at	them	or	did	our	eyes	turn	
away	from	them?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	ham	ne	unheñ	hañsi	banā	liyā	yā	
āañkheñ	un	ki	ṭaraf	se	phir	gayiñ

arabicText: إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ لَحَقٌّۭ تَخَاصُمُ أَهْلِ ٱلنَّارِ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	this	is	really	true	–	the	people	of	the	
hell	quarrelling	among	themselves.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	ye	zaroor	ḥāq	hai	dozakhiyoñ	kā	
bāham	jhagdā.

arabicText: قُلْ إِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ مُنذِرٌۭ ۖ وَمَا مِنْ إِلَـٰهٍ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ ٱلْوَٰحِدُ ٱلْقَهَّارُ
englishTranslationText:
Proclaim	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	–	
peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	“I	am	
purely	a	Herald	of	Warning	-	and	there	is	
no	God	except	Allah,	the	One,	the	All	
Dominant.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāō	maiñ	dar	sunāne	wālā	hi	hoñ	
aur	m'abood	koyi	nahiñ	magar	aik	Allāh	
sab	par	ghalib.

arabicText: رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْغَفَّـٰرُ
englishTranslationText:
“Lord	of	the	heavens	and	the	earth	and	all	
that	is	between	them	-	the	Almighty,	the	
Oft	Forgiving.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mālik	āasmānoñ	aur	zameen	kā	aur	jo	
kuchh	in	ke	darmiyān	hai	sāḥib-e-'izzat	
badā	bakhsh	ne	wālā.

arabicText: قُلْ هُوَ نَبَؤٌا۟ عَظِيمٌ
englishTranslationText: Say,	“That	is	a	great	tidings.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Tum	farmāō	woh	badi	khabar	hai.

arabicText: أَنتُمْ عَنْهُ مُعْرِضُونَ
englishTranslationText: “You	are	neglectful	of	it!”
romanUrduTranslationText: Tum	us	se	ghaflat	meiñ	ho.

arabicText: مَا كَانَ لِىَ مِنْ عِلْمٍۭ بِٱلْمَلَإِ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰٓ إِذْ يَخْتَصِمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
“What	did	I	know	of	the	heavenly	world,	
when	the	angels	had	disputed.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mujhe	'āalam-e-bālā	ki	kyā		khabar	thi	jab	
woh	jhagadte	the.

arabicText: إِن يُوحَىٰٓ إِلَىَّ إِلَّآ أَنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ نَذِيرٌۭ مُّبِينٌ
englishTranslationText:
“I	receive	only	the	divine	revelations,	that	
I	am	purely	a	clear	Herald	of	Warning.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Mujhe	to	yahi	waḥi	hoti	hai	ke	maiñ	nahiñ	
magar	raushan	dar	sunā	ne	wālā.

arabicText: إِذْ قَالَ رَبُّكَ لِلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ إِنِّى خَـٰلِقٌۢ بَشَرًۭا مِّن طِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
(Remember)	When	your	Lord	said	to	the	
angels,	“I	will	create	a	human	from	clay.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	tumhāre	rab	ne	farishtoñ	se	farmāyā	ke	
maiñ	mitti	se	insān	banāoñ	gā.

arabicText: فَإِذَا سَوَّيْتُهُۥ وَنَفَخْتُ فِيهِ مِن رُّوحِى فَقَعُوا۟ لَهُۥ سَـٰجِدِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“So	when	I	have	perfected	him	and	
breathed	into	him	a	spirit	from	Myself,	(you	
all)	fall	down	before	him	in	prostration.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	jab	maiñ	usey	thik	banā	loñ	aur	us	
meiñ	apni	ṭaraf	ki	rooḥ	phooñkoñ	to	tum	
us	ke	liye	sajde	meiñ	girnā.

arabicText: فَسَجَدَ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ كُلُّهُمْ أَجْمَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	all	the	angels	prostrated,	every	one,	
without	exception.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	sab	farishtoñ	ne	sajda	kyā		aik	aik	ne	
koyi	bāqi	na	rahā.

arabicText: إِلَّآ إِبْلِيسَ ٱسْتَكْبَرَ وَكَانَ مِنَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Except	Iblis;	he	was	proud	and	was,	from	
the	beginning,	a	disbeliever.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Magar	Iblis	ne	us	ne	ghuroor	kiyā		aur	woh	
thā	hi	kāfiroñ	meiñ.

arabicText: قَالَ يَـٰٓإِبْلِيسُ مَا مَنَعَكَ أَن تَسْجُدَ لِمَا خَلَقْتُ بِيَدَىَّ ۖ أَسْتَكْبَرْتَ أَمْ كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلْعَالِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Allah,	“O	Iblis!	What	prevented	you	from	
prostrating	before	one	whom	I	have	created	with	My	hands*?	Have	you	become	proud	or	were	you	
haughty	from	the	beginning?”	(Used as a metaphor).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Farmāyā	aey	Iblis!	tujhe	kis	chiz	ne	roñkā	
ke	to	us	ke	liye	sajda	kare	jise	maiñ	ne	apne	
hāthoñ	se	banāyā	kyā	tujhe	ghuroor	āa	
gayā	yā	tu	thā	hi	maghrooroñ	meiñ.

arabicText: قَالَ أَنَا۠ خَيْرٌۭ مِّنْهُ ۖ خَلَقْتَنِى مِن نَّارٍۢ وَخَلَقْتَهُۥ مِن طِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText: Said	Iblis,	“I	am	better	than	him;	You	made	me	from	fire,	and	You	have	created	him	from	clay!”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bola	maiñ	is	se	bahtar	hoñ	tu	ne	mujhe	āag	se	banāyā	aur	isey	mitti	se	paidā	kyā	.

arabicText: قَالَ فَٱخْرُجْ مِنْهَا فَإِنَّكَ رَجِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
He	said,	“Therefore	exit	from	heaven,	for	you	have	been	outcast.”	(To	disrespect	the	Prophets	–	
peace	and	blessings	be	upon	them	–	is	blasphemy.)
romanUrduTranslationText: Farmāyā	tu	Jannat	se	nikal	jā	ke	tu	rāndhā	(la'anat	kiyā	)	gayā.

arabicText: وَإِنَّ عَلَيْكَ لَعْنَتِىٓ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلدِّينِ
englishTranslationText: “And	indeed	My	curse	is	upon	you	till	the	Day	of	Judgement.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	tujh	par	meri	l'anat	hai	Qiyāmat	tak.

arabicText: قَالَ رَبِّ فَأَنظِرْنِىٓ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
englishTranslationText: He	said,	“My	Lord!	Therefore	give	me	respite	till	the	day	when	all	will	be	raised.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bola	aey	mere	Rab!	aisā	hai	to	mujhe	muhlat	de	us	din	tak	ke	woh	uthāye	jāyeñ.

arabicText: قَالَ فَإِنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُنظَرِينَ
englishTranslationText: Said	Allah,	“You	are	therefore	among	those	given	respite.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Farmāyā	to	tu	mohlat	wāloñ	meiñ	hai.

arabicText: إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْوَقْتِ ٱلْمَعْلُومِ
englishTranslationText: “Until	the	time	of	the	known	day.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	jāne	huye	waqt	ke	din	tak.

arabicText: قَالَ فَبِعِزَّتِكَ لَأُغْوِيَنَّهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
englishTranslationText: He	said,	“Therefore,	by	oath	of	Your	honour,	I	will	surely	mislead	all	of	them.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Bola	to	teri	'izzat	ki	qasam	zaroor	maiñ	un	sab	ko	gumrāh	kar	doñ	gā.

arabicText: إِلَّا عِبَادَكَ مِنْهُمُ ٱلْمُخْلَصِينَ
englishTranslationText: “Except	Your	chosen	bondmen	among	them.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Magar	jo	un	meiñ	tere	chune	huye	bande	haiñ.

arabicText: قَالَ فَٱلْحَقُّ وَٱلْحَقَّ أَقُولُ
englishTranslationText:
Said	Allah,	“So	this	is	the	truth;	and	I	speak	
only	the	truth.”	-
romanUrduTranslationText:
Farmāyā	to	sach	ye	hai	aur	maiñ	sach	hi	
farmātā	hoñ.

arabicText: لَأَمْلَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنكَ وَمِمَّن تَبِعَكَ مِنْهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
englishTranslationText:
“That	I	will	fill	hell	with	you	and	with	those	
among	them	who	follow	you,	all	together.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	maiñ	zaroor	Jahannam	bhar	doñ	
gā	tujh	se	aur	un	meiñ	se	jitne	teri	pairwi	
kareñ	ge	sab	se.

arabicText: قُلْ مَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍۢ وَمَآ أَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلْمُتَكَلِّفِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Say	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	–	peace	
and	blessings	be	upon	him)	“I	do	not	ask	any	
fee	from	you	for	the	Qur’an,	and	I	am	not	a	
fabricator.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	farmāo	maiñ	is	Qur’ān	par	tum	se	
kuch	ajr	nahiñ	māñgtā	aur	maiñ	banāwat	
wāloñ	meiñ	nahiñ.

arabicText: إِنْ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكْرٌۭ لِّلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText: “It	is	not	but	an	advice	for	the	entire	world.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Woh	to	nahiñ	magar	nasiḥat	sāre	jahān	ke	
liye.

arabicText: وَلَتَعْلَمُنَّ نَبَأَهُۥ بَعْدَ حِينٍۭ
englishTranslationText:
“And	you	will	come	to	know	of	its	tidings,	
after	a	while.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	zaroor	aik	waqt	ke	b'ād	tum	us	ki	
khabar	jāno	ge.

arabicText: تَنزِيلُ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلْعَزِيزِ ٱلْحَكِيمِ
englishTranslationText:
The	revelation	of	the	Book	is	from	Allah,	
the	Most	Honourable,	the	Wise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kitāb	utārnā	hai	Allāh	Ízzat-o-Hikmat	
Wāle	ki	ṭaraf	se.

arabicText: إِنَّآ أَنزَلْنَآ إِلَيْكَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ بِٱلْحَقِّ فَٱعْبُدِ ٱللَّهَ مُخْلِصًۭا لَّهُ ٱلدِّينَ
englishTranslationText:
We	have	indeed	divinely	revealed	the	Book	
to	you	(O	dear	Prophet	Muhammad	-	peace	
and	blessings	be	upon	him)	with	the	truth,	
therefore	worship	Allah,	as	His	sincere	
bondman.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	ham	ne	tumhāri	ṭaraf	ye	kitāb	ḥaq	
ke	sāth	utāri	to	Allāh	ko	poojo,	nire	us	ke	
bande	ho	kar.

arabicText: أَلَا لِلَّهِ ٱلدِّينُ ٱلْخَالِصُ ۚ وَٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّخَذُوا۟ مِن دُونِهِۦٓ أَوْلِيَآءَ مَا نَعْبُدُهُمْ إِلَّا لِيُقَرِّبُونَآ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ زُلْفَىٰٓ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَحْكُمُ بَيْنَهُمْ فِى مَا هُمْ فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَهْدِى مَنْ هُوَ كَـٰذِبٌۭ كَفَّارٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
Pay	heed!	Worship	is	for	Allah	only;	and	
those	who	have	taken	others	as	their	
supporters	beside	Him	say;	“We	worship	*	
them	only	so	that	they	get	us	closer	to	Allah”;	Allah	will	surely	judge	between	them	regarding	the	
matter	in	which	they	dispute;	indeed	Allah	does	not	guide	one	who	is	a	big	liar,	extremely	
ungrateful.	(*The pagans regarded their idols as smaller Gods and worshipped them. So did the 
Christians. This does not apply to Muslims who only respect their elders, and ask for their 
blessings.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hāñ	khālis	Allāh	hi	ki	bandagi	hai	aur	woh	
jinhoñ	ne	us	ke	siwā	aur	wāli	banā	liye	
kahte	haiñ	ham	to	inheñ	sirf	itni	bāt	ke	liye	poojte	haiñ	ke	ye	hameñ	Allāh	ke	pās	nazdik	kar	deñ	
Allāh	un	meiñ	faisla	kar	de	gā	us	bāt	kā	jis	meiñ	ikhtilāf	kar	rahe	haiñ	be-shak	Allāh	rāh	nahiñ	
detā	usey	jo	jhootā	badā	nā-shukrā	ho.

arabicText: لَّوْ أَرَادَ ٱللَّهُ أَن يَتَّخِذَ وَلَدًۭا لَّٱصْطَفَىٰ مِمَّا يَخْلُقُ مَا يَشَآءُ ۚ سُبْحَـٰنَهُۥ ۖ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْوَٰحِدُ ٱلْقَهَّارُ
englishTranslationText:
Were	Allah	to	create	a	son	*	for	Himself,	He	would	have	chosen	any	one	from	His	creation!	Purity	
is	to	Him!	He	is	Allah,	the	One,	the	All	Dominant.	(*Which	is	impossible.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	apne	liye	bachcha	banātā	to	apni	makhloq	meiñ	se	jise	chāhtā	chun	letā	pāki	hai	usey	wohi	
hai	aik	Allāh	sab	par	ghālib.

arabicText: خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۖ يُكَوِّرُ ٱلَّيْلَ عَلَى ٱلنَّهَارِ وَيُكَوِّرُ ٱلنَّهَارَ عَلَى ٱلَّيْلِ ۖ وَسَخَّرَ ٱلشَّمْسَ وَٱلْقَمَرَ ۖ كُلٌّۭ يَجْرِى لِأَجَلٍۢ مُّسَمًّى ۗ أَلَا هُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْغَفَّـٰرُ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	He	Who	created	the	heavens	and	the	earth	with	the	truth;	He	envelops	the	night	over	day	
and	envelops	the	day	over	night,	and	He	has	subjected	the	sun	and	the	moon;	each	one	runs	for	
its	appointed	term;	pay	heed!	He	only	is	the	Most	Honourable,	the	Oft	Forgiving.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	ne	āasmān	aur	zameen	ḥaq	banāye	rāt	ko	din	par	lapet_tā	hai	aur	din	ko	rāt	par	lapet-tā	hai	
aur	us	ne	chāñd	aur	suraj	ko	kām	meiñ	lagāyā	har	aik	aik	thahrāyi	mi'ād	ke	liye	chaltā	hai	sunta	
hai	wohi	sahib-e-ízzat	bakhsh	ne	wālā	hai.

arabicText: خَلَقَكُم مِّن نَّفْسٍۢ وَٰحِدَةٍۢ ثُمَّ جَعَلَ مِنْهَا زَوْجَهَا وَأَنزَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَنْعَـٰمِ ثَمَـٰنِيَةَ أَزْوَٰجٍۢ ۚ يَخْلُقُكُمْ فِى بُطُونِ أُمَّهَـٰتِكُمْ خَلْقًۭا مِّنۢ بَعْدِ خَلْقٍۢ فِى ظُلُمَـٰتٍۢ ثَلَـٰثٍۢ ۚ ذَٰلِكُمُ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّكُمْ لَهُ ٱلْمُلْكُ ۖ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۖ فَأَنَّىٰ تُصْرَفُونَ
englishTranslationText:
It	is	He	Who	created	you	from	a	single	
being,	and	then	from	the	same	being	
created	its	spouse,	and	sent	down	for	you	
eight	pairs	of	animals;	He	creates	you	in	
your	mothers’	wombs,	from	one	sort	to	
another,	in	a	triple	darkness;	such	is	Allah,	
your	Lord	–	for	Him	only	is	the	kingship;	
there	is	no	God	except	Him;	so	where	are	
you	being	turned	away?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	ne	tumheñ	aik	jān	se	banāyā	phir	usi	se	
us	kā	jodā	paidā	kiya	aur	tumhāre	liye	
chopāyoñ	se	āath	jode	utāre	tumheñ	
tumhāri	māōñ	ke	pet	meiñ	banātā	hai	aik	
ṭaraḥ	ke	b’ad	aur	ṭaraḥ	teeñ	andheriyoñ	
meiñ	ye	hai	Allāh	tumhārā	Rab	usi	ki	
bādshāhi	hai	us	ke	siwā	kisi	ki	bandagi	
nahiñ	phir	kahāñ	phere	jāte	ho.
